channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for FL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for FL

item.title: Report X-2024030791
item.description:
Report X-2024030791

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: PANAMA CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler Trainer called QA over to truck where package was being loaded to, found package on its side with both closures on box being open. The container had leaked out bits of the contents. QA removed the package into a tote and swept up all spilled contents and placed it into the tote. DescribePack: Container had been cracked at the bottom, crack followed along the radius of the cylinder, for about half of the cylinder. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package handlers were cleared from area and P&D manager performed a follow up inspection to verify it was clear.

item.description:
Report X-2024030866

  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came from the NC belt and went to vanline 800. The package went all the way to the van when they pulled the package off and dropped it to the ground. When the PH dropped the package, the package started to leak internally. QA was then quickly alerted and removed the package from the loaders. DescribePack: One cap of the Zep pressure wash solution cracked open and spilled all over the other three bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Removing the package immediately.

DescribePack: The jerrican was dropped onto a bolt on the floor, puncturing the bottom and causing contents to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The jerrican was placed upside down, with the puncture on top, into a hazbag lined tote.

item.title: Report E-2024030391
item.description:
Report E-2024030391

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-22T18:13:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-11
  • City: LAKE PARK
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: EAGLE TRANSPORT CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Driver 18151 was dispatched for a load going to Lake Park Mobil but was given a customer information sheet for Northlake Mobil. Driver did not catch this mistake and went to the wrong location. Once he arrived, he obtained an ATG reading that verified his load would not fit. The driver overfilled the tank and this resulted in a spill that impacted a drain. After investigating this with the APEC rep it was determined that the Reg tank was able to hold an additional 200 gallons of regular. Because the tanks are manifolded the rest of the product flowed into the premium tank. Only approximately 12 gallons of product was actually spilled. CDG managed the response and cleanup.

  • Description: Driver stated he pulled away from the pump with the hose still connected causing mechanical damage to the customer’s connection resulting in a spill.
